Gibbs Sampler for the truncated multivariate normal distribution

rtmvnorm.gibbs.Rd

Gibbs Sampler for the truncated multivariate normal distribution

rtmvnorm.gibbs(
  n_sim,
  sigma,
  lower,
  upper,
  fixed = (lower == upper),
  ind = 1,
  burn_in = 1000
)

Arguments

n_sim

Number of draws from the Gibbs sampler (after burn-in).
sigma

Covariance matrix for the multivariate normal distribution.
lower

Lower truncation for the normal distribution. It can be -Inf.
upper

Upper truncation for the normal distribution. It can be Inf.
fixed

Should variables be fixed? Logical vector with an entry for each dimension. Default is TRUE when upper is equal to lower.
ind

Indices of variables to return from the Gibbs sampler. Default is 1 and corresponds to the first variable (usually the genetic liability of the first phenotype). Use c(1, 5) to return both the first and fifth variables.
burn_in

Number of iterations that count as burn in for the Gibbs sampler.

Value

The sampling values from the Gibbs sampler for the variables ind.

References

Kotecha, J. H., & Djuric, P. M. (1999, March). Gibbs sampling approach for generation of truncated multivariate gaussian random variables. In 1999 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing. Proceedings. ICASSP99 (Cat. No. 99CH36258) (Vol. 3, pp. 1757-1760). IEEE. doi: 10.1109/ICASSP.1999.756335

Wilhelm, S., & Manjunath, B. G. (2010). tmvtnorm: A package for the truncated multivariate normal distribution. The R Journal. doi: 10.32614/RJ-2010-005

Examples

samp <- rtmvnorm.gibbs(10e3, sigma = matrix(c(1, 0.2, 0.2, 0.5), 2),
                       lower = c(-Inf, 0), upper = c(0, Inf), ind = 1:2)
